intro: Isotrema dilatatum, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their distinctive inflorescences called spathes. The plant features arrowhead-shaped leaves that are typically bright green and have a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
